body:
SharePoint helps organizations meet regulatory requirements by offering features like document retention policies, audit trails, version history, and access controls. These tools ensure that documents are securely stored, properly tracked, and only accessible to authorized users. SharePoint also supports compliance standards (like GDPR, HIPAA, etc.) by enabling organizations to manage data privacy, security, and retention as per legal and industry regulations.

Please referring this:
Document Retention & Lifecycle Management
•	SharePoint enables organizations to implement granular retention policies, ensuring documents are retained for a predefined duration before secure deletion.
•	Supports legal hold functionality, preventing unauthorized modifications or deletions during audits, investigations, or litigation.
Audit Trails & Activity Monitoring
•	Provides comprehensive audit logging, capturing user interactions such as document access, edits, and deletions.
•	Facilitates compliance with regulatory frameworks like SOX (Sarbanes-Oxley), GDPR, and HIPAA by offering traceable and immutable activity records.
Version Control & Data Integrity
•	Ensures automated versioning, maintaining historical revisions and preventing accidental data loss.
•	Enables version rollback, allowing users to restore previous document iterations while preserving compliance requirements.
Access Governance & Security Controls
•	Enforces role-based access control (RBAC) to safeguard sensitive information by restricting access to authorized personnel.
•	Enhances security through multi-factor authentication (MFA) and conditional access policies, mitigating unauthorized access risks.
Advanced Compliance & eDiscovery Capabilities
•	Aligns with global regulatory standards, including GDPR, HIPAA, and ISO 27001, ensuring organizations meet data protection requirements.
•	Supports Microsoft Purview eDiscovery, allowing legal teams to efficiently locate, retrieve, and analyze compliance-related content.
